org.openide.filesystems.spi

Interface CustomInstanceFactory


  • public interface CustomInstanceFactory
    Creates instance of the desired class based on the file. Module providers may register factories to control creation of instances from files that use only file name or instanceClass attribute.

    Registered factories are called in the registration order, until one provides a non-null result, which become the file's created instance. If all factories return null, the FileSystems API will create the instance using the default constructor.

    Module implementors are encouraged to use the instanceCreate attribute instead.

    Since:
    9.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> T createInstance(Class<T> clazz)
      Creates an instance of the class.

      • createInstance

        <T> T createInstance(Class<T> clazz)
        Creates an instance of the class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the desired type
        Parameters:
        clazz - the desired type
        Returns:
        an instance of the `clazz' or null
